candidates.title: [next] tests: CI go green
candidates.body:
## Description of change
Fixes up the last few tests in the next branch to make sure they will all pass.

## How Has This Been Tested (if applicable)?
Using `cargo test`

candidates.title: feat: extract service integrations into separate crates
Feature/eng 486 update deployer with runtime changes
candidates.body:
## Description of change

This updates deployer to work with the changes we made to the runtime. So for legacy it starts the users project with the embedded runtime (and sends the path to the same runtime in the load request, but it isn't used in the legacy runtime load function), and for shuttle-next it installs and starts the shuttle-next runtime binary, and then sends the users compiled .wasm file in the load request.

TODO:

- [ ] Can probably clean up some of the code in deployer.
- [ ] Figure out if we fix the tests here or after merging/backporting changes from https://github.com/shuttle-hq/shuttle/pull/580

## How Has This Been Tested (if applicable)?

Most of the tests pass, but the ones that deal with a project crashing or stopping don't. This is likely solved in https://github.com/shuttle-hq/shuttle/pull/580, so I'm not sure if we need to do it in this PR.

candidates.title: chore: v0.11.3
candidates.body:
## Description of change

We are bumping static folder and publishing a release of that, as well as redeploying gateway and deployer so the gateway uses the new deployer, the new deployer is necessary since it uses patched local versions of the resource libraries.

candidates.title: Feature: eng 483 trim and fix the tests in shuttle-service

TODO: remove loader tests.

## How Has This Been Tested (if applicable)?

candidates.title: bug: idle static folder
candidates.body:
## Description of change

This fixes static folder projects not starting up correctly after they went into idle mode. This would happen because the static folder resource would move the folder and therefore could not move it a second time when an idle project is woken up.

This change causes the static folder resource to rather copy the folder.

Closes issue #689 

## How Has This Been Tested (if applicable)?
Locally, with a full running setup and the axum websocket example

candidates.title: Feature/eng 477 make wasm dependencies optional
candidates.body:
## Description of change

The WASI dependencies for shuttle-next are quite heavy. This PR makes them optional, and the next-runtime bin dependent on the `next` feature.

## How Has This Been Tested (if applicable)?

Ran legacy and next, they still work as expected, but legacy has fewer dependencies.

candidates.title: Feature: eng 465 update all the codegens
candidates.body:
## Description of change

Rewrite the codegen of shuttle_main to use shuttle_runtime to start the users project binary. Also refactored the `local_run` function to work with this change. Refactoring deployer remains, but I think that should be done in a follow-up PR.

TODO:

- [x] Clean up the codegen, I essentially just unwrapped the wrapper currently. 
- [x] Refactor unwrap of return type.
- [x] Fix the tests.

## How Has This Been Tested (if applicable)?

Local runs of two axum examples, one hello_world and one with the static files resource.

candidates.title: Feature: remove tokio runtime from all resources

We no longer need to pass a runtime to the resourcebuilder, so we can remove it and tokio from all the resources.

## How Has This Been Tested (if applicable)?

This has been tested by making sure they all compile and that the tests pass for the resources that have tests.

candidates.title: feat: extract next runtime into separate binary

## Description of change

This makes the next-runtime its own binary in `src/bin/next`. 

Also closes ENG-467

## How Has This Been Tested (if applicable)?

I updated the readme on how to run this locally, and the integration tests still pass. Load, start, subscribe logs and stop work as expected.

candidates.title: feat: remove box self from services, remove syncwrapper from axum service
candidates.body:
## Description of change

Removes box self from services and syncwrapper from axum service since they are no longer needed.

This PR is based on https://github.com/shuttle-hq/shuttle/pull/675

## How Has This Been Tested (if applicable)?

candidates.title: refactor: find code to wrap legacy runtime
candidates.body:
## Description of change
This finds the new code that we will need to codegen to start a legacy service with our new runtime.

With this change we will also be able to do the following:
- Get rid of the `Sync` requirement for services
- Get rid of the `runtime` in resources
- Correctly stop deploys
- Get rid of the FFI :partying_face: :tada: :confetti_ball: 

## How Has This Been Tested (if applicable)?
Manually using `grpcurl`

candidates.title: Remove time v0.1 dependency from main crates
candidates.body:
- Mongodb v2.4.0 got rid of its time v0.1 dependency. This plus removing default features on chrono results in all of shuttle's main  crates not depending on it (by default, shuttle-service with thruster still does due to thruster's direct dependency on it).
- Removed Cargo.lock from .gitignore since it is being tracked by git.

candidates.title: Feat: unbox the ClaimService and Scoped futures
candidates.body:
We can unbox the future type in tower layers if we implement future ourselves. For how I landed on the implementation for ClaimService, see: https://github.com/tower-rs/tower/blob/master/guides/building-a-middleware-from-scratch.md

For what inspired the enum solution for the Scoped future, see: https://github.com/tower-rs/tower/blob/master/tower/src/load_shed/future.rs#L13-L63

candidates.title: refactor: update opentelemetry in all our crates
feat: auth cache
candidates.body:
This PR adds a cache in front of the reverse proxy in the `ShuttleAuthLayer` that tries to upgrade a cookie or api-key bearer token to a JWT. The cache is first checked for the key (cookie or api-key), if it is there set it on the request in the `ShuttleAuthLayer`. If it isn't, request an upgrade from the `auth` server through the proxy. If it succeeds, extract the token from the proxy response and set it in the cache, before setting it on the request and proceeding.

It would have been more elegant to have the cache be a layer on the proxy client, but I had some difficulty implementing this. It's certainly something we should consider in the future.

All tests pass except for one assertion in the `api_create_get_delete_projects` test, which is commented out. It was indeed broken, but it was testing functionality we don't have.

candidates.title: [auth] feat: add an auth module to shuttle common
candidates.body: I suspect we'll want more helpers, but am not sure what they are yet

candidates.title: feat: create an auth project + clap
fix: add repo url to cargo-shuttle for binstall
candidates.body:
[`cargo-binstall`](https://github.com/cargo-bins/cargo-binstall/blob/main/SUPPORT.md#support-for-cargo-binstall) needs the crate to have a repository set in its manifest for it to find the binary download. We should only need to set it for `cargo-shuttle`, but it's nice to have for all our published crates. 

There was also an issue with the windows bin build where the tag was not included in the archive name, due to that build running the `make-artifact` command with powershell. I resolved this by changing the shell for the windows build to bash, and using a powershell override for the other commands.

I also changed the name of the directory inside the archive to be [compatible](https://github.com/cargo-bins/cargo-binstall/blob/main/SUPPORT.md#examples) with `cargo-binstall`.

And last but not least, I added the `x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu` target to the linux binary builds.

candidates.title: feat: build our images with the release profile
candidates.body:
Currently our containerfile builds crates with the default debug profile, which means when `get_runtime_executable` is called it will try to install from a checked out local version of `shuttle-runtime`. This will work when making images, but fail when the deployer containers start a runtime, since the local version wont be available (even though for deployers the runtime will be installed during make images).

Changing to build the crates will release profile will also not work currently, since it looks for the runtime on the production branch.

Tldr: using debug assertions might not be enough for this, I will investigate further on wednesday.
